intro: Buena pavonii, commonly known as the Mexican pavonia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Buena pavonii is often used in ornamental gardening for its vibrant floral display.
